channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Canva’s billionaire founders are minting overnight millionaires with employee share sale
item.description: Past and present “Canvanauts” will be able to sell up to $3 million of their vested equity, an internal email says.

item.title: Winter is coming: U.S. will be most vulnerable to a recession late this year and early next as tariff and immigration fallout peak, top economist says
item.description: With the economy facing many threats, it wouldn’t take much to push it into recession, Mark Zandi warns.

item.title: Ethereum brushes record high after Fed Chair says ‘balance of risks’ is shifting
item.description: Investors interpreted Jerome Powell’s remarks as evidence for September rate cuts.

item.title: Why does an independent Fed matter? Just look at Ronald Reagan’s economy with Paul Volcker hiking rates to nearly 20%
item.description: Independent central banks can more easily take unpopular steps to fight inflation, such as raise interest rates, which makes borrowing more expensive.

item.title: Cracker Barrel’s first rebrand in nearly 50 years backfired. The company’s stock lost nearly $100 million after introducing a more minimalist look
item.description: The restaurant chain has gotten heat, accused of going too woke.

item.title: Intel agrees to U.S. government stake, Trump says. It may not be the last.
VIX plunges after Powell sparks optimism for September rate cut
Trump says he’ll fire Lisa Cook. Here's why that might not happen.
Watch live: Powell speaks at Jackson Hole as Fed's interest-rate decision looms
Stocks end sharply higher after Powell opens door to rate cut in Jackson Hole
